titleStmt.title: Brief conclusions of dancers and dancing Condemning the prophane vse thereof; and commending the excellencie of such persons which haue from age to age, in all solemne feasts, and victorious triumphs, vsed that (no lesse) honourable, commendable and laudable recreation: as also true physicall obseruations for the preseruation of the body in health, by the vse of the same exercise. Written by I.L. Roscio.
Conclusions upon dances, both of this age, and of the olde
titleStmt.author: Lowin, John, 1576-1659.

titleStmt.title: Brief conclusions of dancers and dancing Condemning the prophane vse thereof; and commending the excellencie of such persons which haue from age to age, in all solemne feasts, and victorious triumphs, vsed that (no lesse) honourable, commendable and laudable recreation: as also true physicall obseruations for the preseruation of the body in health, by the vse of the same exercise. Written by I.L. Roscio.
Conclusions upon dances, both of this age, and of the olde
titleStmt.author: Lowin, John, 1576-1659.

publicationStmt.publisher: For Iohn Orphinstrange, and are to bee sold at his shop by the Cocke and Katherine-wheel neere Holbourne bridge,

notesStmt.note: A reissue of "Conclusions upon dances, both of this age, and of the olde", STC 16874. The title page was printed by W. Hall on A1, originally blank; the original title page and dedication (A2-3) are cancelled in the only known copy.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
